data.title: Jesús Franco
data.meta_description: Jesús Franco Manera, also commonly known as Jess Franco, was a Spanish filmmaker, composer, and actor, known as a highly-prolific director of low-budget exploitation and B-movies. He worked in many different genres during his career, but was best known for his horror and erotic films, often incorporating surrealist elements.
data.text:
In this Spanish name, the first or paternalsurname is Franco and the second or maternal family name is Manera.

Jesús Franco Manera (12 May 1930 – 2 April 2013), also commonly known as Jess Franco, was a Spanish filmmaker, composer, and actor, known as a highly-prolific director of low-budget exploitation and B-movies.[1] He worked in many different genres during his career, but was best known for his horror and erotic films, often incorporating surrealist elements.[1]

Quick Facts Born, Died ...

Close

In a career spanning from 1954 to 2013, he wrote, directed, produced, acted in, and scored approximately 173 feature films,[1][lower-alpha 1] working both in his native Spain and (during the rule of Francisco Franco) in France, West Germany, Switzerland and Portugal. Additionally, during the 1960s, he made several films in Rio de Janeiro and Istanbul.[1]
